intro: Zephyranthes refugiensis, commonly known as the refuge rainflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in the summer months, producing white or pale pink flowers that are fragrant and attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant for warm climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
